source_sentence: 佛說睒子經
translation: Foshuo xiaozi jing

source_sentence: 西秦沙門聖堅奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by the Western Qin śramaṇa, Shengjian, under the auspices of the imperial edict

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在比羅勒國，與千二百五十比丘俱，及眾菩薩、國王、大臣、人民，長者、居士、清信、士女不可稱計，一時來會。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the country of Pirolaka, and he was accompanied by twelve hundred and fifty monks, along with an incalculable number of bodhisattvas, kings, ministers, people, elders, householders, pure believers, and women who had come together at one time.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「皆悉寂靜定意聽！
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "All of you, be still and concentrate your thoughts and listen!

source_sentence: 我念前世，初求得菩薩道時，戒行普慈，精進一心，智慧善權方便不可稱說，諸天、龍神、帝王、人民無能行者。」
translation: I remember a past life when I first sought to attain the bodhisattva path, when my moral conduct was universally compassionate, my effort was single-minded, and my wisdom, skillful authority, and skillful means were ineffable, and there were no gods, dragons, gods, emperors, or people who could perform them."

source_sentence: 阿難聞佛所言，更整衣服，長跪白佛：「願欲聞之。」
translation: When Ānanda heard what the Buddha said, he adjusted his clothes, knelt down long enough, and said to the Buddha, "I wish to hear about it."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「乃往過去無央數世，時有一菩薩名曰慈慧，救濟群生，常行四等心，度世危厄，愍育苦人。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "It was an uncountable time in the past when there was a bodhisattva named Maitreya, who saved all sentient beings, always practiced the four kinds of equanimity, saved the world from distress, and pitied suffering people.

source_sentence: 於是，處在兜率天上教授天人。
translation: He was then teaching gods and humans up in Tuṣita Heaven.

source_sentence: 常以晝夜各三時三昧定意，思惟三界，照觀十方天下、人民善惡之道。
translation: He always contemplates the three realms with the samādhi concentration of the three periods of day and night, and he illuminates and observes the world and the ways of the people in the ten directions, both good and bad.

source_sentence: 孝養父母，敬奉三尊，供侍師長，修諸功德，皆悉明見，五道分明。
translation: They take care of their parents, honor the three honored ones, serve their teachers, and cultivate merit, all of which are clearly seen, and the five paths are clearly delineated.

source_sentence: 「時，迦夷國中有一長者，孤無兒子，夫妻兩目皆盲，心願入山求無上慧，修清淨志信樂虛閑。
translation: "At the time, there was an elderly man in Kāsi country who was orphaned, had no son, and his husband and wife were both blind.

source_sentence: 菩薩念言：『此人發意欲學妙道，而兩目盲無所視見，若入山者或墮溝坑，或逢毒虫所見危害，若我壽終當為作子，供養父母終其年壽。』
translation: The bodhisattva thought, 'This man has aroused the desire to train in the wondrous way, but he's blind and lacks vision; if he enters the mountain, he might fall into a ditch or meet a venomous insect that sees danger; if I were to reach the end of my life, I would become a son and support my parents for the rest of their lives.'

source_sentence: 即便往生盲父母家，為其作子。
translation: He'll then go home to his blind parents and make them his sons.

source_sentence: 父母歡喜愛之甚重，本發道意欲行入山，以生子故，便樂世間。
translation: His parents were so delighted and fond of him that they originally had the intention to travel to the mountains and enter the world because they wanted to have a son.

source_sentence: 子年七歲號字曰睒，睒至孝仁慈，奉行十善：不殺、不盜、不婬、不欺誑、不飲酒、不妄語、不嫉妬、信道不疑、晝夜精進，奉侍父母如人侍天，言常含笑不傷人意，行則應法不妄傾邪，於是父母即大歡悅，無復憂愁。
translation: When he was seven years old, he was called Śākyamuni, and he was very filial and kind. He practiced the ten good qualities: don't kill, don't steal, don't commit sexual misconduct, don't deceive, don't drink alcohol, don't speak falsely, don't be jealous, believe in the Way and don't doubt it, make effort day and night, serve his parents as one serves the gods, always speaks with a smile and doesn't offend people, and acts in accord with the Dharma and doesn't falsely incline toward error.

source_sentence: 「睒年過十歲，睒自長跪，白父母言：『本發大意欲入深山，求志虛寂無上之道，豈以子故而絕本願。
translation: "When he was more than ten years old, he knelt down long enough to tell his parents, "I had originally had the great intention to go into the deep mountains and seek to pursue the tranquil and unsurpassed path, but is it because of my son that I've cut off my original vow?

source_sentence: 人居世間無常百變，命非金石對至無期，願如本意宜本先志，自隨父母俱共入山，侍養之宜不失時節。』
translation: Since people live in the world, which is impermanent and ever-changing, and since life is not made of metal or stone, there's no time to reach it, so I hope that, according to my original intention, I'll follow my parents into the mountains and serve them without losing track of time.'

source_sentence: 父母報睒：『子之孝順天自知之，不違本誓，便即入山。』
translation: His parents rewarded him, 'God knows how dutiful and obedient their son is; don't violate this vow, and then you'll enter the mountain.'

source_sentence: 睒以家中所有財寶，皆大布施諸貧窮者，便與父母俱共入山。
translation: He gave away much of the family's wealth and possessions to the poor and needy, and then went with his parents into the mountains.

source_sentence: 「睒到山中，以柴草作屋，施置床蓐，不寒不熱恒得其宜。
translation: "When he arrived in the mountains, he made a hut of wood and straw and provided a mat that was always suitable, whether it was cold or hot.

source_sentence: 入山一年眾果豐實，食之甘美，泉水涌出清而且涼；池中蓮華五色精明，栴檀雜香，樹木豐盛，香氣倍常。
translation: For a year after entering the mountain, there was an abundance of fruit that was delicious to eat, and the springs welled up clear and cool; the lotus in the pond had five brilliant colors, sandalwood was fragrant, and the trees were abundant and their fragrance was twice as constant.

source_sentence: 飛鳥常集，奇妙異類，皆作種種音樂之聲，娛樂父母；師子、熊羆、虎狼、毒蟲，慈心相向無相傷害。
translation: Flying birds always gather, and marvelous creatures make all kinds of musical sounds to entertain their parents; lions, bears, tigers, wolves, and venomous insects all kindly face each other without harming each other.

source_sentence: 食草飲水無復恐懼，麞鹿、眾鳥皆來附近，與睒音聲共相哀和娛樂之音。
translation: They eat grass and drink water without fear, and the wild deer and birds all come near, making melodious and joyful sounds together with the glittering voice.

source_sentence: 睒至孝慈，蹈地常恐地痛，天、神、人、鬼皆來擁護此三道人；三道人者，一心定意，無復憂愁。
translation: Being so dutiful and kind, he's always afraid of the pain of the ground when he steps on it, and gods, spirits, humans, and ghosts all come to support him in the three paths.

source_sentence: 「睒常與父母取百種果以食父母，泉水無乏。
translation: "He always takes a hundred kinds of fruit with his parents to feed them, and there's no lack of spring water.

source_sentence: 時，父母渴欲得飲水，睒被鹿皮衣提瓶行汲水，麞鹿、眾鳥亦往飲水，不相畏難。
translation: When his parents were thirsty and wanted to drink, Cao carried a flask in his deerskin robe to draw water, and deer and birds also went to drink, not being intimidated by each other.

source_sentence: 時，有迦夷國王入山射獵，王見水邊有諸群鹿，放弓射之。
translation: When the king of Kāśyapa went into the mountains to hunt, he saw a herd of deer near the water and shot them with his bow.

source_sentence: 箭誤中睒，正射其胷。
translation: The arrow mistakenly struck Sugatha, hitting him square in the head.

source_sentence: 被毒箭已，舉身皆痛，便大呼言：『誰持一箭殺三道人？』
translation: After being struck by the poisoned arrow, his body ached, and he cried out, saying, 'Who killed three people of the Way with one arrow?'

source_sentence: 王聞人聲，即便下馬往到睒前，睒謂王言：『象坐牙死，犀坐其角死，翠坐其毛，麞鹿坐皮肉，我無牙角、無毛、無皮肉不可噉，今有何罪橫見射殺？』
translation: When the king heard the noise of the people, he dismounted from his horse and went to Śākyamuni, who said to the king, 'An elephant dies while sitting on its tusks, a rhinoceros dies while sitting on its horns, a kingfisher dies while sitting on its hair, and a deer dies while sitting on its hide; I have no tusks, horns, hair, or hide to devour, so what crime have I committed by being shot dead in front of you?'

source_sentence: 王問睒言：『卿是何人？
translation: The king asked, 'Who are you?'

source_sentence: 被鹿皮衣與禽獸無異。』
translation: Clad in deerskin, he's no different from an animal.'

source_sentence: 睒言：『我是王國中人，與盲父母俱來學道二十餘年，未曾而為虎狼毒蟲所見枉害，今我便為王所射殺。』
translation: Cao said, 'I'm a native of the kingdom who came with my blind parents more than 20 years ago to train in the way, but I've never been seen by tigers, wolves, or venomous insects and been harmed, and now I've been shot dead by the king.'

source_sentence: 「當爾之時，大風暴起，吹折樹木，百鳥悲鳴，師子、熊羆、走獸之輩皆大號呼，動一山中；日無精光，流泉為竭，眾華萎死，雷電動地。
translation: "At the time, a great wind arose, breaking down trees, making a hundred birds cry out in pity, and a great cry from lions, bears, and animals that moved up a mountain; the sun was devoid of light, the fountains dried up, the flowers withered and died, and thunderstorms rattled the ground.

source_sentence: 時，盲父母即自驚起曰：『是何變異？
translation: The blind parents then startled themselves and got up, saying, 'What's the transformation?'

source_sentence: 睒行取水經久不還，將無為毒蟲之所害耶。
translation: Wouldn't it be possible for a venomous insect to harm him if he didn't return after a long time spent fetching water?

source_sentence: 禽獸悲鳴，音聲號呼不如常時，風起四面樹木摧折，必有災異。』
translation: When the animals cry out in lamentation and their voices cry out differently than usual, and the wind rises and breaks down trees on all sides, there's bound to be trouble.'

source_sentence: 時，王怖懅大自悔責：『本射眾鹿誤相中傷，射殺道人其罪甚重，坐貪少肉而受此殃，願以珍寶以救子命。』
translation: The king then became frightened and greatly repented, 'I was mistakenly wounded when I shot at the deer, and I've committed a terrible sin by shooting dead a follower of the Way, and I wish I could save my son's life by giving him precious treasures.'

source_sentence: 「時，王便前欲拔出箭，箭深不出，百鳥禽獸四面雲集，皆大號呼動一山中。
translation: "When the king then stepped forward to pull out the arrow, the arrow didn't come out deep, but a hundred birds and animals gathered on all sides, all shouting and moving up a mountain.

source_sentence: 王益怖懅，支節皆動，睒語王言：『非王之過！
translation: The king became increasingly frightened, and his limbs all shook.

source_sentence: 自我宿罪緣對所致，我不惜身，但念我盲父母耳，年既衰老，兩目復盲，一旦無我，亦當終沒，無瞻視者，以是之故，自懊惱耳。』
translation: I don't scorn myself as a result of the opposition of my past sins, but I'm mindful of my blind parents, and as I grow old and my eyes become blind again, once I'm gone, I'll also end up with no one to look at.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，諸天、龍、神皆為肅動。
translation: At that point, the gods, dragons, and spirits were all disturbed.

source_sentence: 王又重言：『我寧自入地獄之中，自受此罪，使睒身活。』
translation: The king then repeated, 'I'd rather go to hell and suffer this sin myself so that Serpico's body will live.'

source_sentence: 長跪向睒悔過陳言：『若子終沒，我不還國，便住山中，供養卿盲父母，如卿在時，勿以為憂，諸天、龍、神皆當證知，不負此誓。』
translation: He knelt down and repented to Cao, saying, 'If my son dies, I won't return to my country; I'll stay in the mountains and support your blind parents; don't take it personally while you're here; the gods, dragons, and spirits will all realize that I won't be held responsible for this vow.'

source_sentence: 「睒聞王誓：『雖被毒箭，心喜意悅雖死不恨，以我父母累王供養，王當罪滅，得福無量。』
translation: "He heard the king vow, 'Even though I was shot with a poisoned arrow, my heart rejoiced, and I didn't hate him even though I had died, so the king will extinguish my parents' crimes and obtain immeasurable merit if I burden him with offerings.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『卿當語我父母之處，及子未死吾欲知之。』
translation: The king said, 'You must tell me about my parents' place, and I want to know about it before my son dies.'

source_sentence: 睒即指示：『從是徑去，去此不遠當見草屋，我之父母在其中止。
translation: Cao instructed him, 'Take this path, and not far from here you'll see a straw hut where my parents are staying.

source_sentence: 王徐徐往，勿令父母驚動怖懅，以善方便解語其意，王當為我上白父母，無常今至，當就後世。
translation: The king will explain to my parents that impermanence has now arrived and that they will pass into the afterlife.

source_sentence: 我不惜命，念盲父母年既衰老、兩目復盲，一旦無我無所依仰，以是懊惱自酷毒耳。
translation: I don't value my life, but I think of my blind parents as they grow old and blind again, and once they lack a self and have no one to look up to, I'll be so distressed that I'll poison my own ears.

source_sentence: 我死自分宿罪所致，無可得脫，今自懺悔，從無數劫有身以來，所行眾惡，於此罪滅，願與父母世世相值，不相遠離，當令父母終保年壽，勿有憂患，天龍、鬼神常隨護助，災害消滅，所欲應意，無為自然。』
translation: Now, I repent that I've committed numerous bad deeds since I was born countless eons ago, and now that these sins have ceased, I want to be with my parents from generation to generation and not be separated from them, so that my parents will live to the end of their lives and not be troubled, and that gods, dragons, and spirits will always be there to protect them, so that disasters and hardships will cease and their wishes will be fulfilled without fail.'

source_sentence: 「王將數人詣父母所，王去之後，睒奄死矣。
translation: "The king sent several people to their parents' home, and after he left, Di An died.

source_sentence: 百鳥、禽獸四面雲集，皆大號呼，遶睒尸，上舐是胸血。
translation: A hundred birds and animals gathered on all sides, all wailing and shouting, surrounded Śākyamuni's body and licked his blood from his chest.

source_sentence: 盲父母聞此音聲，益怖彷徉而住。
translation: When the blind parents heard this sound, they became frightened and wandered off.

source_sentence: 王行駛疾，觸動草木，肅肅有聲，父母驚言：『此是何人？
translation: As the king traveled quickly, he touched the grass and trees with a loud, solemn noise, and his parents were startled and said, 'Who is this man?'

source_sentence: 非我子行。』
translation: He's not my son's practice.'

source_sentence: 王言：『我是迦夷國王，聞盲道人在山學道，故來供養。』
translation: The king said, 'I'm the king of Kāsi, and I heard that a blind man was training on the mountain, so I came to make offerings.'

source_sentence: 盲父母言：『枉屈大王來相慰勞，遠臨草野，王當疲極體安隱不？
translation: The blind parents said, 'Have you wasted your time, Your Majesty, coming here to offer your comfort, and will you be so tired and comfortable that you're out in the wilderness?'

source_sentence: 宮殿夫人、太子、官屬皆安善不？
translation: Are the ladies of the palace, the crown prince, and the officials all well?

source_sentence: 風雨和調五穀豐不？
translation: Are the winds and rain harmonizing and the grains abundant?

source_sentence: 隣國人民不相侵害耶？』
translation: Do the people of the neighboring countries not harm each other?'

source_sentence: 王答道人：『得蒙尊恩，常自平安。』
translation: The king answered the wayfarer, 'I've been honored and have always been at peace.'

source_sentence: 又更問訊盲父母：『在此山中勞大勤苦，樹木之間，甚難為止，自安隱不？』
translation: He also asked the blind man's parents, 'Do you work hard in these mountains, where it's difficult to stop the trees, and are you at peace?'

source_sentence: 盲父母言：『蒙大王恩，常自安隱，我有孝子，字名曰睒，常取果蓏泉水無乏；我有草席，王可就坐，果蓏可食。
translation: The blind parents said, 'By the grace of the great king, I've always been at ease. I have a dutiful son named Glitter who always gets fruit and water from the springs without running out; I have a straw mat that the king can sit on and fruit to eat.

source_sentence: 睒行取水，正爾來還。』
translation: He walks around fetching water, and just then he comes back.'

source_sentence: 「王聞盲父母言，又大傷心，涕泣其言：『我罪實重，入山射獵，遙見水邊有諸群鹿，引弓射之，箭誤中睒；道人子睒已被毒箭，其痛甚酷，今故自來語道人耳。』
translation: "When the king heard what his blind parents said, he was deeply distressed and wept, saying, 'My crime was really serious. I went into the mountains to shoot a deer, and I saw a herd of deer near the water, so I drew my bow and shot them.

source_sentence: 父母聞之，舉身自撲，如太山崩地為大動，號哭仰天，自陳訴言：『我子睒者，天下至孝，無有能過，蹈地常恐地痛，有何罪故而射殺之？
translation: When his parents heard this, they threw themselves up and threw themselves against him like a great mountain crumbling to the ground, cried out and looked up to heaven, and said, 'My son Glitter is the most dutiful person in the world, unsurpassed, and he always fears the pain of the ground when he steps on it.

source_sentence: 向者，大風卒起，吹折樹木，百鳥悲鳴，皆大號呼動一山中。
translation: A great wind suddenly arose, breaking trees and causing a hundred birds to cry out in pity, all shouting and moving up a mountain.

source_sentence: 我在山中二十餘年，未曾有此災異之變，而我子睒取水不還，恐當有故，諸神皆驚，肅肅而動。』
translation: I've been in the mountains for more than 20 years, and I've never seen such a catastrophic change, but my son glanced at the water and didn't return, so I'm afraid there must be a reason.

source_sentence: 母便涕哭，不肯復止，父言：『且止！
translation: His mother then burst into tears and refused to stop, but his father said, 'Stop!

source_sentence: 人生世間，無有不死？
translation: Is there nothing in this world that is immortal?

source_sentence: 無常對至，不可得却。』
translation: It's impermanent and arriving, and it's impossible to escape.'

source_sentence: 但問王：『睒為射何許，今為死活？』
translation: But he asked the king, 'Did he ever glance at the sky for permission to shoot, and now is he dead or alive?'

source_sentence: 王以睒語向父母說，其盲父母聞王此語，又大感絕：『一旦無子，俱亦當死。
translation: When the king spoke to his parents in glittering terms, their blind parents heard the king's words and were deeply moved, 'Once we have no children, we'll both die.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 今者牽我二人往子尸上。』
translation: Now, take us both and lead us to the corpse of our son.'

source_sentence: 「王即牽盲父母往到尸上，父抱其頭，母抱兩脚著其膝上，各以兩手捫摸睒箭，仰天呼言：『諸天、龍神、山神、樹神，我子睒者，天下至孝，是諸天龍、鬼神所知。
translation: "The king then led his blind parents to the corpse, put his father's arm around his head and his mother's arm around his knees, each touched the Śākyamuni's arrow with his two hands, and called out to the gods, saying, 'Gods, dragon spirits, mountain spirits, and tree spirits, my son Śākyamuni is the most filial person in the world and is known to gods, dragons, and spirits.

source_sentence: 我年已老，目無所見，身代子死，睒活不恨。』
translation: I'm old and have no eyes to see; I'll die in my son's place, but I won't hate him if I glance at him alive.'

source_sentence: 於是，父母俱共誓言：『若睒至孝天地所知，箭當拔出，毒痛當除，睒應更生。』
translation: Then, both parents vowed together, 'If Furu is most dutiful and known to heaven and earth, the arrow will be removed, the pain of the poison will be removed, and Furu will be reborn.'

source_sentence: 「於是，第二忉利天帝座即為動，以眼見此二盲道人抱子號呼，乃聞第四兜率天上，釋梵四王從天上來，如人屈伸之頃，來住睒前，以神妙藥灌睒口中，藥入睒口，箭拔毒出，更生如故。
translation: "They then heard from the fourth Tuṣita Heaven that the four Śākyamuni kings had come from heaven and stayed in front of the Śākyamuni like men in a state of flexion and extension. They poured a wonderful medicine into the Śākyamuni's mouth, which removed the poison from the arrows and revived him as before.

source_sentence: 父母聞睒以死更生，兩目皆開，飛鳥、走獸皆大歡樂之音，風息雲消日為重光，流泉涌出清而且涼，池中蓮華五色精明，栴檀雜香，樹木光榮香倍於常。
translation: When his parents heard that he had been reborn from the dead, his two eyes were opened, birds and animals made loud, joyful noises, the wind calmed and the clouds disappeared, the sun shone brightly again, streams and springs welled up clear and cool, the lotus in the pond had five brilliant colors, and the fragrance of sandalwood and trees was twice as brilliant as usual.

source_sentence: 時王歡喜不能自勝，禮天帝釋，還禮父母及子睒者：『願以一國所有財寶，俱上道人自相供養，令我罪滅永無有餘。』
translation: Overjoyed, the king paid homage to Indra, returned to his parents, and paid homage to his son Cao, saying, 'May I offer up all the wealth and treasure of a single country to all the people of the Way, so that my sins may be ended and there may be no more.'

source_sentence: 「睒語王言：『欲興福者，王但還國，安慰人民，當令奉戒，王勿射獵橫殺無辜，身不安隱，壽終當入泥犁之中。
translation: "He said to the king, 'Those who want to promote goodness, the king should simply return to his country, comfort the people, and make them observe the precepts; the king mustn't shoot, hunt, or kill innocent people; his body won't be made secure, and he'll end up in a mire when his life span ends.

source_sentence: 人居世間恩愛暫有，別離久長不得常在。
translation: The affection of people living in the world is temporary, but separation is long and doesn't last forever.

source_sentence: 王宿有福今得為王，莫憍自在，以自在故，造無量惡，後入惡道，悔之何益。』
translation: The king was blessed in the past and has now become king; don't be proud of your independence; because of that independence, you'll do measureless evil and later enter a bad path; what good will it do to repent?'

source_sentence: 王答：『如教。』
translation: The king replied, 'As you've been taught.'

source_sentence: 隨王獵者，見睒死已，得天神藥死而更生，父母眼開神變如是，悉奉五戒、修行十善，死得生天，無入惡道。」
translation: Those who follow the king's hunter will see Cao die and then obtain the goddess of medicine to revive them after death, and their parents' eyes will be opened and their miracles will be like this. They all observe the five precepts and cultivate the ten good qualities, and they'll be born in heaven after death and won't enter a bad path."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「諸來會者，宿命睒者，吾身是耶；盲父者，閱頭檀王是；盲母者，今王夫人摩耶是也；迦夷國王者，阿難是；天帝釋者，彌勒佛是。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "All those who have come to meet us, the Śākyamuni who was born in the past life is me; the blind father is King Cūḍadantī; the blind mother is the present king's wife, Māya; the king of Kāśyapa is Ānanda; and the Śakra who is Maitreya Buddha."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「吾前世時，為子仁孝、為君慈育、為民奉敬，自致得成為三界尊。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "In a previous life, I was kind and filial to my sons, loving and nurturing to my ruler, and respectful to the people, and I was able to become the honored one in the three realms."

source_sentence: 佛說經已，時諸菩薩、比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷莫不歡喜，作禮而去。
translation: After the Buddha spoke the sūtra, the bodhisattvas, monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen rejoiced, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: 佛說睒子經
translation: Foshuo xiaozi jing
